content:
Here are 10 common reasons that cause delays in residential building construction in NSW:

1. Weather conditions
2. Labour Shortages
3. Unforeseen site conditions.
4. Variations from the owner.
5. Design changes
6. Errors or omissions by the architect (e.g., deficient drawings, specs, etc.)
7. When contractors have to wait for the architect to respond to a Request for Information (RFI).
8. Material delays
9. Project Mobilisation Delays
10. Permitting issues

In my messages that I send you later, I will refer to this information as Common reasons. Just remember this information for now. I will message you instructions in later messages. If you understand this instruction, limit your reply by saying the word: "acknowledged".

Please write in English language.
